text: Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi (; ; ; born 2 May 1944) is a Thai billionaire businessman. He is the founder of Thai Beverage, the chairman of conglomerate TCC Group and Fraser and Neave, Ltd(F&N;). He is now the largest property developer and landlord in of 630,000 rai (100,800 hectares), in Thailand. He also owns 50 hotels in Asia, the US, UK, and Australia, including Plaza Athénée in Manhattan and The Okura Prestige Bangkok. , Forbes said his net worth at US$10.5 billion. In 1988, King Bhumibol of Thailand granted the family the name "Sirivadhanabhakdi". ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Thai businesspeople Category:Billionaires Category:People from Bangkok
